div.p: MS. Ch. Berks. 20a Hugh de Fonte grants to W., prior &c. of W. in free alms, 6½ acres of arable land in Eston and one rood of meadow in Wynterdole, which John, formerly vicar of Eston, once held from him. Witnesses: Robert of Sumel’, Alexander de Stall[is], Nicholas de Stall[is], William the esquire, Roger the clerk, William the marshal, Nicholas þinbern’. He …, Adam of Aldentone. c. 1220.

MS. Ch. Berks. 42a Hugh son of Robert of Chalcford, grants to Ralph of Watlingtone, prior &c. of W., in free alms, 2 half acres and one rood of arable land in Eston, in Wodewayforlong. Witnesses: Sir Alan fitz-Rowald, Auger of Rodelan’, Henry … of Chalkeforde, Roger le marssal, Geoffrey Wodewarde. c. 1270.–74.

MS. Ch. Berks. 42b The same grants to the same, in free alms, two half acres in Eston in Longeheggesforlong. Witnesses: Sir Baud[ewin] …, Sir Henry le Tyeys, Simon atte more, William Thurburd, … le mareschal, Henry West, Geoffrey the prior’s clerk. c. 1270.–74.

MS. Ch. Berks. 19 Indenture by which the priory grants to William de Leukenore 2½ acres of land in Chalcford lying in Medforlang, la Lure, and by Copinghomeweye in exchange for land lying in front of the court of the convent at Chalcford, called Wiþescroft. Witnesses: Roger parson of Leukenore, Walter Bacun, Hubert of Hatfeld, Ralph Pol of Sidenham, Adam of Sopicote [Sapcote], William the marshal, Robert de la more, Nicholas Gulias. c. 1270–74.

MS. Ch. Berks. 22 Roger son of Peter of Chalcford grants to W. in free alms a croft called Chalfcroft in Chalcford, except a third part which Isowde, mother of William the marshal holds in dower. Rent 12d. For this the monks gave him 2½ marks. Witnesses: Thomas of Gingestone, Adam of Copicote, Nicholas the clerk, Hugh of Stockenechun …, Auger de la Redelan’, Robert Melesop, Hugh de la Lip, Henry son of Peter, Richard son of Nicholas. c. 1270–74.

MS. Ch. Berks. 37 Hugh son of Robert of Chalkford, grants to W. in free alms one acre of arable land in C. in Holewellefurlong. For this sir Ralph of Watlington prior of W. gave him [7/- or 10/-]. Witnesses: sir Geoffrey de Leukenore, steward of the honour of W., sir William Huschal, sir Thomas de Valencis, knights, master Ralph of Belvero (?), Robert de Louches of W., William the marshal, … of Chalcford, William the esquire of the priory of W., William of Synynes, Geoffrey the clerk of …etinge. c. 1270–74.

MS. Ch. Berks. 5 Geoffrey the cook of Wareng’ grants to W. in free alms 7 acres of arable land and all his other land in C., lying in ’peecam de W.’ on the North, free of all secular service, ’ego enim et heredes mei eam acquietabimus per officium nostrum in coquina’ … For this gift made for the souls of Brian fitz-Count, his lord, and the lady Matilda his wife, he has received from the monks 60/-, and his son half a mark. Witnesses: Thomas Balle, Geoffrey de Yvoi, Nicholas son of Turolde, Thomas de Uruvall, Hugh de Yvoi, Ralph of Alu’b, Hamo Purun, Gilbert Basset, Matthew of Sottewelle, Andrew son of Peter, William son of Richard, James son of Nicholas, Andrew the clerk. 1127–50.

MS. Ch. Berks. 12 Gilbert son of Adam the cooper grants to John of Devonshire that messuage in C. which R. treasurer of the Hospital [of S. John] with the consent of the chapter confirmed to Adam the cooper, father of the said Gilbert. Rent 12d. to the hospital and 1d. to Gilbert and his heirs. For this John gave him 16 marks. Witnesses: James capellanus de opido, Robert de Bavra, Thomas of Devonshire, Henry de porta, Walter son of Henry, Roger balistarius, John son of Adam the cooper, Asketil the dyer. c. 1220–30.

MS. Ch. Berks. 11 Henry de porta grants to William the clerk of W., for his homage and service one acre of arable land in C. in Koclingforlong. Rent 1d. Witnesses: William son of Simon, Nicholas de stall[is], Hubert of Hotfelde, Simon Gurmund, Alexander Dublet, John de Luches, Robert de Bavra, Nicholas de Basinges, Henry son of Ywo, William son of Henry, Gilbert cunarius, Henry the clerk. c. 1220–30.

MS. Ch. Berks. 14 Gilbert de Hande grants to W. and the sacristan, half an acre of land in C. Rent 2d. Witnesses: Nicholas de stall[is], Hubert [Ho]tfeld, Clement the clerk, Peter the vintner, Nicholas de Basinges, Henry son of [], Simon de Basinges. c. 1220–30.

MS. Ch. Berks. 18 William son of Geoffrey de aula confirms to W. in free alms, the gift of his father, who is buried there, of 5 acres of arable land and one acre of meadow in C. Witnesses: …aller of Sandervile, John of Sottewelle, Miles of Mortone, John le Fleming, John Basset, Alexander Dublet, Nicholas de Stall[is], Clement the clerk, Hubert of Hatfelde. c. 1230–40.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 1 Stephen son of Richard de Clopcote grants to Joan, late the daughter of John his son, for her service, 2 acres of arable land in C. of which ½ acre lies at Stanidelf between the land of Henry de Furns and that of John son of Nicholas de Basing, ½ acre at Sunenhelve on the south of Sir Stephen de Cheynduit’s land, ½ acre between the said Sir S. de C.’s land and that of H. de F., towards the north in the shot called Hilond, and ½ acre at Vifaker. Rent: 6d. Witnesses: Nicholas de Stall[is], Alexander de Stall[is], John fitz-Nicholas de Basinges, Simon de Basinges, William de aula, Henry fitz-Yvo, Henry son of Walter West, Peter Ywun, Henry de la Barre, Robert son of Walter West, William the clerk. c. 1235.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 2 William son of John de Clopcote confirms to Joan his sister the gift which Stephen her grandfather made to her of two acres of land in C., ½ acre between Sir S. de C.’s land and that of H. de F., reaching to the shot called Inlond, ½ acre at Vifacres, which is the Westernmost of 3 half-acres lying together there, by the land of H. de F. Rent 6d. Witnesses: Nicholas the goldsmith, mayor of W., Nicholas de Stallis, Gilbert Cunar’, John de Basinges, Robert de Luches, John de Luches, Walter de Furno, Philip de Basinges, Adam de Cokam, clerk. c. 1270–80.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 3 Thomas de la Sale son and heir of William de la Sale grants to Nicholas son of Clement, clerk, for 40/- (1) 2 parts of an acre of arable land in Golasfurlonghetum the land of N. f. C. and the land which Agnes, mother of T. de la S. held in dower, reaching south to the prior’s long acre; (2) ½ acre of arable land in the same shot between the said Agnes’ land on each side. Rent: a gillieflower. Witnesses: Sir John de St. John, William de Mackenaye [Macknay], John de Luchiis, Robert de Sottewelle, Robert de Brihtwaltone, Andrew de Butelor’, John Huberd. c. 1270–80.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 4 Matilda relict of John le arblaster of Clopcote grants to William le scheperde and Amye his wife (i) an acre of arable land in C. in the shot called Schyllyngewurthe between the said Matilda’s land and that of Anycya her daughter, reaching to the South to Ruscheweye. (ii) an acre of meadow in the meadow called Hememede. Witnesses: Richard de Louches, Osbert of Notele, Robert of Meleborne, William of Muleborne, Richard atte Char, Alan Rossel, Nicholas atte Barre, Robert Boneface, clerk. Given at C. 19 Jan. 1310.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 5 Isabella daughter of John Huberd of C. quit-claims to Cecilia, late the daughter of Simon de Elyntone, her right by inheritance or by reason of Wymarke her mother &c. in one acre of arable land called Leytoneacre, in C., between the land some time of Matilda le arblaster and that of Jordan le carpenter. Witnesses: Swayn of Mortele of W., Richard de Louches of the same, John Mariot of the same, Thomas Gratard of the same, William of Mulebourne of the same. Given at C. 8 April 1316.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 6 Richard son of John de Basyngges of Wallingford quit-claims to Gilbert the goldsmith (1) 8d. rent from William the dyer of W.
for land in Clopcote, (2) 1½d. rent from Henry le Munfort, similarly, (3) 1½d. rent from Simon … (4) 2d. from Elena la gardinere, similarly. Witnesses: William Sundy, Nicholas le taverner, John le gredere, John de Louches, Gilbert du char, Nicholas le Bercher, Roger the clerk. Given at Wallingford. [Partly effaced.] 1 July 1316.

MS. Ch. Berks. 61 Osbert son and heir of Thomas le ferror of W. grants to Richard de Louches of W. his right in 2 crofts of arable land in C., viz. one lying above la Lhinche, the other at Pute … s. Witnesses: Robert of Sottewelle, Rolond of Hastang, Robert of Makkeneye, John atte Forteye of Astone, William of Lattone, Robert Boneface. Given at C. 27 Dec. 1320.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 7 Roger son and heir of John le porter of Wallingford grants to William Soundy of W. 2 acres 1 rood of meadow in the North meadow of Clopcote, ’sicut sors annuatim condonat.’ Witnesses: Richard de Louches, John Mariot, Robert of Sottewelle, Gilbert atte char, Alan Rossel, William of Mulebourne, Thomas le Noble, John de Louches, Thomas of Berewyk, William Arnyat, Walter le cripse, William Buty. Given at C. 9 July 1323. Small circular seal, in black wax; a squirrel, S’ WILLELMI …

MS. Ch. Berks. 69 Richard son and heir of John de Louches, of W., quit-claims to William Blakemer of Cokham and Cecilia his wife, his right in one acre of land in Clopcote, which Cecilia had of the gift of Jordan Huberd of C., and which lies between the land of Jordan le carpenter and that of Ralph le arblaster, and is called la Leightone acre. Witnesses: John de Louches, brother of the grantor, Sweyn of Mortleye, Walter of Basinges, Walter le carpenter (?), … son of Osbert of Notelee, Thomas Dene, Gilbert du char. Given at W. 16 March 1325.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 8 Indenture by which Benedict de Glaunvyle of Wallingford grants to William de Suthmortone, clerk, a piece of arable land called La Gore, outside the west gate of W. in the field of Clopcote, with the adjacent head-acre between the highroad and the field called Hongerhulle, the said Gore extending towards Sottewelle Crouche, from 21 Dec., 1324 to Mich. next, and then for 11 years. Witnesses: Robert of Sottewelle, Richard de Louches, Alan Rossel of Clopcote, Nicholas le coupere, Thomas of Oterborne, Gilbert du char, Walter le crypse. Given at Clopcote. 21 Dec. 1324.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 9 Benedict de Glaunvyle of Wallingford grants to William de Suthmortone, clerk, a head acre of arable land ’que est forera’, lying in Clopcote between B. de G.’s land and that of the prior of W., reaching north to Hongerhulle. Witnesses: Richard de Louches, John atte Forteye de Astone, junior, Robert of Sottewelle, Robert of Makkeneye, Nicholas of Medford, Gilbert atte char, Alan Rossel of C., Robert Boneface, clerk. Given at C. 13 Jan. 1326. Seal.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 10 Alan Russel grants to Richard his son and Helen a daughter of William Blakemor, one acre of arable land called Le ettonacur, in C., between the land of Jordan le carpenter on the east, and that late of Agnes Ricote on the West, reaching on the south to the said Jordan’s garden, and to the north to the land of William le Schepherde and the land of John le Gredere. Witnesses: Robert Butti, John Witing, Gilbert le char, Nicholas le coupare, Thomas of Hoturboune, Walter le cripse, Simon Kenhelm. Given at C. 4 Nov. 1325. Seal: pointed oval, 1”, head of a man in armour, S’ ALANI · ROSSEL.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 11 John son of Osbert of Notlee of Wallingford grants to Walter le Cripse of W. one acre lying in Clopcote at Le Vifacres between Walter le crispe’s land on the east and the grantor’s land on the west. Witnesses: Sweyn of Mortele, Roger Badecok, John Whitynge, William Boty, Alan Russel, Symon Kenelm, John of Blebury, Gilbert du char, Robert Boty. Given at Clopcote. 13 Nov. 1326.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 12 John son of Osbert of Notele of W. and heir of Agnes daughter of Nicholas Clement, grants to Walter le cripse of the same two ½ acres of arable land in C. (Boundaries.) Witnesses: Richard de Louches, Swayn of Mortele, Gilbert du char, John of Blebury, William le ferur, Simon Kynelm, Roger the clerk. Given at C. 8 July 1327.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 13 Indenture by which Roger Badecok of W. grants to Alice his daughter 5 scattered acres of arable land in C. by Wallingford, (1) is forera, at la Punde by Thomas le Arblaster’s land on the south, reaching east to la Greneweye which leads to Hodesbot, (2) between the land late of Sir William de Bereford, kt., on either side, reaching to William of Melebourne’s land towards the north
Mill, and called la Forsshetase, (3) ½ acre between the land late of Henry Ywon on either side, at le Flexlond, reaching to the lynche towards Shillingford bridge, ½ acre between the land of William le Deyar’, merchant, and that of Henry Ywon, reaching to the said lynche, (4) in the shot called Stomforlong between Eustace Clements’ land and that of Richard de Louches, (5) one acre in Middelforlong between the land late of Richard du char and that of Thomas le arblaster, reaching to le Russhepathe towards the west. Rent: 10 qrs. of barley. Witnesses: Richard de Louches, John son of Osbert of Notele, William Badecoke, Gilbert du char, Walter le cripse, Thomas son of Alan Rossel, Thomas Bone. Given at W. 1 Nov. 1327. Berks. ch. 69b. is the other half of this indenture.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 14 Roger Badecoke of W. quit-claims to John son of Roger of Blebury of W. and Alice his wife and R. B.’s daughter, those ten quarters rent [see M. 13]. Given at W. Witnesses: Swayn. of Morteley, John Mariot, Thomas Bone, William Badecoke, Richard Gratard, Roger of Mortone, Roger son of Nicholas the weaver. 8 April 1331.

MS. Ch. Berks. 71 John, son of Osbert of Notle of W., grants to John of Wy … of All Saints, W., one acre of arable land in C., in Middelforlong. Witnesses: Gilbert du char, Walter le crypse, Thomas of 0[tterburne], Peter son of Alan Rossel, [] called of Meleborne, inkeeper, John of Poleham, Simon Kynelm, Robert Boneface, clerk. Given at C. 8 April 1329.

MS. Ch. Berks. 72 William Badecok of W. grants to Walter Crypse a toft with arable land adjacent, lying between the said Walter’s land on the north, and the garden which belonged to Sir William de Bereford by Wallingford castle on the south, in the village of C., reaching from the high road on the west to the barbican of the castle on the east. It is 28 feet wide by the road, and 68 feet by the barbican; length 55 and 58 feet. Witnesses: Richard de Louches: Gilbert du char, Thomas Aleyn, Simon Kenelm, Nicholas le coupere. Given at C. 6 Feb. 1331.

MS. Ch. Berks. 73 Indenture by which Walter le crypse grants to William of Melbourn of the county of Leicester 12d. rent of an acre of arable land in C., lying at Gourishesdene. Witnesses: Sweyn of Mortleye, Gilbert du char, Thomas Aleyn, Simon Kenelm, Nicholas le coupere. Given at C. 23 April 1331.

MS. Ch. Berks. 75 John of Notele son of Osbert of Notele of W., grants to the priory all his lands, goods, and chattels in W., or C., or elsewhere. Witnesses: Richard Moryn, mayor, Richard de Lusches, Richard Wyting’, John [ ? constable] of Wallingford castle, Thomas Aleyn, Thomas of Otterburne, Gilbert de Char of C. Given at W. 29 Sept. 1333.

MS. Ch. Berks. 76 William son of William the marshal of W., grants to William March Heron, prior, &c. of W. 8 acres of arable land in C. viz. 3 acres in or abutting on Algarsforlong, ½ acre in le Inlond, between the Shillingford road on the West and le Rysshepathe on the east, 1 acre at Gykendene, 1½ acres Tounforlong, ½ acre in le Thistelforlong, ½ acre in Westlingforlong. Witnesses: Richard de Louches, Gilbert du char, Thomas Aleyn, Thomas of Oterburne, Walter Crips, William Knight, clerk. Given at C. 12 March 1334.

MS. Ch. Berks. 77 The same to the same: 5 acres of arable land in C., viz: 2½ acres at le Pende; 1½ acre in Cockleforlong, 1 acre in Middelforlong. Witnesses: Richard Moryn, mayor, Richard de Louches, Gilbert du Char, Thomas Alayn, Walter Crips, Nicholas le coupere, Thomas of Oterburne, William Knight, clerk. Given at C. 12 March 1334.

MS. Ch. Berks. 78 Alan of Goldeburghe grants to William Heron, prior &c. of W. 7½ acres of arable land in C., and an acre of meadow, viz.: ½ acre at Hongerhulle, ½ acre in le Flexlonde, above le Pende, 2 acres in Algarsforlong, 1 acre at la Grodelonde, above Algarsforlong, ½ acre near the Shillingford road, 1 acre at Gondricheshulle, 1 acre in Middelforlong (½ acre of which reaches la Rysshepathe), ½ acre not specified, ½ acre in the common meadow ’prout sors condonet annuatim in sorte Alicie Reynaudyn’, ½ acre similarly ’in sorte Ricardi de Louches’. Witnesses: [as in no 77, without Nicholas le coupere]. Given at C. Same date.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 15 Indenture witnessing that John son of Eustace Randoulf of W. has enfeoffed Andrew de Sutton of the same with 2 acres of arable land in C. in the shot called Le Puynde between Sir Edmund de Bereford’s land on the north and that of Richard Moryn of W. on the south, reaching above Westweye on the east, and towards the west to Monekedene. If John pays Andrew 40/- in 6 years the grant shall be null. Witnesses: Richard Moryn,
Robert Butty, Robert of Makkeneye, William Barefot, Gilbert du Char, Walter le Cripse, Thomas Aleyn. Given at C. 23 Aug. 1335.

MS. Ch. Berks. 82 Richard de Louches grants to Wm. Heron, prior &c. of W., a croft in C. at le Lynches. Witnesses: Roger ate Nasshe, steward of Wallingford castle, Richard Moryn, mayor, Robert Wityn, John Mariot, Gilbert du char, Thomas of Oterburne. Given at C. 19 April 1336.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 16 Robert Butti of W. grants to William of Mulleburne called the taverner of W. a toft of arable land in C. reaching to the highroad from Wallingford to Dorchester on the west. Witnesses: Richard Moryn, John Maryot, Gilbert du char, Thomas Alayn, Thomas of Oturbourne. Given at W. 14 April 1336.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 17 Henry le Veysin of Warborwe grants to Walter Stephenes son William S., of C., and Elisia his wife, daughter of John Saleber of Warborwe, 4 acres of arable land in C., at the Lynch, in Middelforlonge, and over Clapcotehulle, (Boundaries). Witnesses: Ralph Restweld, Richard de Louches, Alan Rossel, Gilbert atte char, Robert Boneface. Given at C. Wed. after St. Clem ent, 13 or 17 Ed. III. Seal.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 18 Indenture witnessing that John son of Eustace Randolf of Wallingford has enfeoffed John atte Rysshe of the same with the 2 acres mentioned in M. 15 on the same condition. Witnesses: William Barefote, Walter Whatinod, Roger atte Mulle, Robert of Mackeney, John Ruydale, Gilbert atte char, Robert of Toppefeld, clerk. Given at C. 22 Oct. 1339.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 18a The deed of gift of the same to the same. Same date and witnesses. Blunted oval seal, ⅔”, a spread eagle rising out of foliage.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 19 John Maryot of W. grants to John ate Russche of the same, one acre of arable land in C. in Medforlong, between William de Cornwaille’s land on the north, and that late of Matilda Daynes on the south. Witnesses: Robert Butty, Philip de Louches, Walter Crypsse, Gilbert du char, Thomas Alayn, William Wrouch, Thomas Oturbourne. Given at W. 20 Jan. 1341.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 20 Walter le crupse of W. quit-claims to John atte Rysshe of W. and Alice his wife, his right in one acre of arable land in C. in the culture called Fyfacres between John fitz-Richard de Louches’ land on the west, and that of William Badecoke on the east, reaching on the north above the prior’s land. Witnesses: William de Lattone, William Barefot, Roger atte Mulle, Robert of Mackeneye, Gilbert atte char, Thomas de Oterboume, Robert of Toppefeld, clerk. Given at C. 19 Feb. 1341.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 21 Walter Stephenes son of William Stephen grants to Henry le Veysin de Warborghe [the 4 acres described in M. 20]. Witnesses: as in M. 20, as the first, Richard de Louches. 30 Sept. 1341.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 22 Gilbert de char de C. grants to John atte Rysshe of W. one acre of arable land in C. in Middelforlong, between the land of Sir Edmund de Bereford on the south, and that of Richard Moryn on the north. Witnesses [Robert of] Toppefeld, clerk. [The others are illegible.] … Ed. III.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 23 John Maryot of W. quit-claims to John atte [Ru]ssche of the same his right in one acre of arable land in C., in Medforlong. Witnesses: Robert Butty, John de Louches, Walter Cirpsse, William du char, Thomas [], William Wrouch, Thomas Oturbourne. Given at C. [Torn.] 1 March 1342. Small circular seal in reddish-brown wax: a man’s head, bearded.

MS. Ch. Berks. 88 William Skyp of W. quit-claims to Walter Cryps his right in ½ an acre of arable land in C. in the shot called Cornwayles inlondes. Witnesses: John Maryot, Robert Boti, John atte Russche, Richard Moryn, John of Blebury, Thomas Alayn, William Wrote, Gilbert du char, Richard of Bryhtwalton, clerk. Given at C. 5 May 1342.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 24 Walter Cirpsse of W. grants to John ate Russche of the same ½ acre of arable land in C., in Algareforlang, between Edmund de Bereford’s land on the east and that of Alice Kenelm on the west, reaching from south to north over William de Cornwaille’s land called Inlond. Witnesses: John Maryot, Robert Butty, Thomas Alayn, William Wrouch, Thomas Oturbourne. Given at C. 14 Jan. 1344. Seal.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 25 Robert de Croxford and Geoffrey Cheyndut, chaplains, grant to John atte Rysshe of W. and Alice his wife 4 acres of arable land called la Goore, in C., of which one acre is forera, between the prior’s land on the east and the land wh. J. and A. his wife have of the gift of R. de C. and G. C., and 3 acres lie together from the said forera to the cross on the way from W. to Abingdon. Witnesses: John Mariot, John of Brictwalton, John Garstone, Reginald le taverner, Thomas of Oterboume, Walter Crys, William Wyte. Given at C. 15 Oct. 1344. Two Seals: (1) as in M. 24. (2) the Virgin and child, standing, a standing figure on either side, blunted oval.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 26 William son of William Whicthele of W., and heir of Joan wife of the said William Whicthele, quit-claims to John atte Rysshe his right in one acre of arable land in C. in Medforlong, between William de Cornewaille’s land and that late of Reginald de Badecoke, which acre Hawise late the wife of Eustace Paring held in dower. Witnesses: John Mariot, John Garstone, Reginald Taverner, Thomas Alayn, Walter Cripse, William Wrote, Thomas of Oterbourne. Given at W. 17 Jan. 1349. Circular seal, ⅔”; a stag.

MS. Ch. Berks. 92 Indenture by which Stephen Cryps, chaplain, grants to John Broun, porter, Alice his wife, and John son of Henry of Stapleford, a tenement in All Saints’, and two acres of land in C., in Medforlond, for their lives, reserving to himself a plot containing a well, from which his father Walter Cryps used to procure free stone. Rent 6/-. They have granted to the said Stephen a solar with free entry and exit at reasonable hours (temporibus opportunis). Witnesses: John de Anesty, John atte Ruysche, Philip Gylot, John Horspathe, Richard Folyot, John Louches, Robert, clerk. Given at W. 29 June 1349.

MS. Ch. Berks. 93 Richard Oterbourne of C. grants to John atte Rysshe of W. 3 acres of arable land in C. … viz. one acre at le Pathe leading to le Westweye, one at le North Mulle, and one at Schillyng-wurthe. Also one acre of meadow in C. ’prout sors condonat’. Witnesses: Reginald le taverner, Richard Folyot, John Kary, John de Louches, Richard atte char. Given at C. 25 Oct. 1349.

MS. Ch. Berks. 142 John Horsepathe of W. grants to Richard Folyot and Alice his wife one acre and one rood of meadow in the gore of the northmede of C. Witnesses: Nicholas Payable, mayor, John Ruysshe, Robert Taverner, William atte Garstone, John Broun, porter. Given at C. 8 March 1352.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 27 Alice Horsepathe late the wife of John Horsepathe of W. grants to Alexander de Chelseye, rector of the church of Chynnore, Robert Wolveleghe, vicar of the church of Westhenrerthe, and John de Estbury, junior, 3½ acres of arable land lying together in C. at the north end of Inlondes de la Ruschecourt. Witnesses: Robert Holte, John James, William Harewelle, Henry Redynges, Robert Boty. Given at C. 25 Sept. 1358.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 28 Alice Folyot of W. grants to Alexander of Sholseye rector of the church of Chynnore, Robert Wolvele, vicar of the church of Westhenrerthe, and John son of John of Estbury, 5 acres of arable land late of Roger Badecok, in C. Witnesses: Robert Holte, mayor of W., John James, John Ergtwoltone, William Harewelle, William Arnegate, Thomas Hakeberne. Given at C. 25 Jan. 1362.

MS. Ch. Berks. 102 Richard of Lichfeld, chaplain, grants to Alexander of Cholseye, rector of Chinnore, Thomas of Kyngesburi, vicar of Harwelle, Robert Wolueleghe, vicar of Westchurche, and John of Estburi, junior, 5½ acres of arable land in C. viz.: 2½ acres at le Buttes on the west of the highroad leading to le Barge, one acre at the quarry, one acre at le Shitehap, one acre at the head of Thistleforlong, abutting on the field of Sottewelle. Witnesses: William Harwelle, Robert Butty, Henry Rodynge, and Roger Preston of W., Nicholas Kenelm, and John Yonge of C. Given at C. 23 Oct. 1363.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 29 Alice Horsepathe, late the wife of John Horsepathe of W. grants power of attorney to John Arblaster, clerk, to deliver seisin to [grantees of M. 70] of ½ acre in land of la Russchecourt. 26 May 1366. Small circular seal, attached by torn tag: a ship.

MS. Ch. Berks. 112 John Swayn grants to Alexander of Cholseye, rector of Chinnore, Robert Wolveleghe, vicar of West Henreth, and Walter Shatmot,
one acre of arable land in C. in Bataylforlong. Witnesses: John James, William Harewelle, Henry Deme (sic), Henry Redynge, Nicholas Kenelm. Given at C. 8 Feb. 1370.

MS. Ch. Berks. 125 Alexander, rector of Chynnore, grants to William de Dynham prior &c. of W., a messuage, 83 acres of land, 5 acres 1½ roods of meadow in C. Witnesses: Richard atte Felde, mayor, John Lorkyn, Roger Arniat, Roger Mylborne, William Amiat, William Shelyngford, William Wodeward, Thomas Desforde of C., Adam Fauconer of C. Given at C. 10 May 1383.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 30 Alice Hapselon grants to Cristina James de W., William Motte, and Elena his wife, one acre of arable land in C., between the prior’s land on each side. Witnesses: Laurence Hawman, Robert Hapselon, Richard Brouns. 3 Nov. 1406.
Seal.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 31 William Motte of W., grants to Thomas Rothewelle, Richard Kene, and William Cayme, one acre of arable land in C., in the Overthystellefurlong, the fourth acre from the road called West-bargewaye. Witnesses: John Warfelde, mayor, Lawrence Hawemane, John Bensshef, Richard Colles, William Bodyngtone. Given at C. 23 March 1431. Small circular seal with monogram of William Motte.

MS. Ch. Berks. 143 Indenture by which sir Edmund Rede, kt., demises to Wm. Herdewik, prior &c. of W., his manors of Ruyschcourt and Clopcote lately held by Thomas Slade and Robert Broun, with 2/- rent from an orchard and garden in W. by Wodestrete on the west and Lekestrete on the east, for 99 years. Rent 40 marks. Given in the chapter-house. 7 Dec. 1465.

MS. Ch. Berks. 51 Indenture by which Gregory, prior &c. of W. grant to the lady Sarah, prioress &c. of Goring, one virgate of land in Goring, called Cunestables lond. Rent: 5/-. Witnesses: Peter, bishop of Exeter, Sir Hugh Bunival, kt., John Luches, mayor of W., Gilbert Pynscoun, William de la Wyk, John son of Hubert. Given at W. 3 Feb. 1285.

MS. Ch. Berks. 52 Indenture by which Gregory, prior &c. of W., quit-claim to Sir John de Chausy, kt., son of Geoffrey de Chausy of Mapledurham, their right in one acre of meadow called Hawlvesacre and a rent of 10 estiches of eels or 2/- in M., which had been in dispute, in return for 5/- annually. Witnesses: Sirs John de Dykeby, steward of the honour of W., Edmund de Wedone constable of W., Alan fitz-Rowald, Elias de Whytefelde, kts., Gilbert Pynsun of Molesham, John Fachel, Thomas Hykun. 26 April 1289.

MS. Ch. Berks. 4 Miles de Nothercot grants to W. in free alms ½ a virgate of land in Nothercot, which Stephen the son of Richard the miller of Salingford held. Witnesses: Adam parson of Chenhora, Henry de scaccario, Matthew Brond, Hugh of Pochel’, John of Cennore, William of Wudesmundeston, William son of Andrew, Gilbert son of Gerard, Robert Lerun, William Germund. c. 1180.
Quainton Mallet (Bucks.).

MS. Ch. Berks. 9 Hirvoy Malet of Quentune, son of Ruelend, grants to W. the ½ virgate which Hugh Malet his cousin and tenent gave to the sacristran. Witnesses: Thomas de Munceas, Geoffrey de la Mare, William de Arches, Reginald Leangeun, Richard Morin, Thomas of Witeham, Robert son of William, Ralph de Port, Robert de Basingges, Ralph Sailard. c. 1200–1210.

MS. Ch. Berks. 10 Hugh Malet of Quentune grants to the sacristran of W. in free alms [the same] half virgate. Witnesses: … Hyrvoy Malet, William de Arches, Reginald Langeun, Ri . . . . . . Robert son of William, Ralph de Port, Robert de Basingges, Ralph Sailard. [Mutilated.] c. 1200–1210. The witnesses are almost certainly as in Berks. ch. 9, which is written in the same hand.

MS. Ch. Berks. 117a Thomas Smyth of Ippesdene [Ipsden] and Alice his wife grant to sir John Kentewode, kt., Alexander of Cholseye parson of Chynnore, Walter Whatmot, 7 acres of arable land in Sottewelle,
late of Henry Sottewelle. Witnesses: Walter Yonge, John Mayn, Henry Deme, Robert Boty, John Arblaster. Given at S. 4 Sept. 1375.

MS. Ch. Berks. 8 Master Christian of W., grants to W. in free alms certain lands: (i) … which Robert son of P . . hel’ holds, for 6/6; (ii) … mill for 4/-; (iii) the other land which Renur the clerk gave to him; (iv) also Walter and Osbert for 2/4; (v) after his death, all his books of the Divine Scriptures. For this they have granted him a daily provision of food and drink for himself [as long as ?] he shall remain a secular, and for his servant according to the provision made for a servant of the priory. Witnesses: Andrew son of Peter, … Ferr’, William Gurmund. c. 1190–1200.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 32 Geoffrey fitz-Edmund grants to Gilbert the marshal a tenement ’in vallo castelli’ of Wallingford, which David his father held before him. Rent: 2/-, but if the rent due from the burgesses of W. to the King, and fixed by King John, shall be pardoned, the rent shall be 6d. Witnesses: John de Wechenholthe, sheriff of Berkshire, Thomas de Munceaus, Richard Morin, Richard de parco, Richard of Brichtewelle, Walter Cotele, James son of Jukell, William sapiens, Robert son of William, Thomas of Witheham, Richard Ferrant. 1204–15.

MS. Ch. Berks. 16 William Gurmund of W. grants to the sacristan of W. in free alms, to provide 3 lamps and 6 candles (each of three pounds) annually, and at least two candles and three lamps at every service, in honour of the blessed Virgin, 13/2 in quit-rents in W. and C. Wm. abbot of S. Alban’s, and Th. prior of W. seal the charter with Wm. Gurmund. Witnesses: Master Stephen of Hettefeld parson of Wenggrave [Wingrave], Walter, parson of … horn, William parson of Kingesburi, Roger of Cornwall, rector of Brithewelle, Henry, chaplain of Holy Trinity, Wallingford, William … Robegild, Hubert of Hatfeld, Nicholas des Estaus, Alexander Dublet, Peter the vintner, John son of Robegild, Nicholas de Basinges, Ralph of Wy …, Roger of Hatfeld, Andrew the baker. 1214–35.

MS. Ch. Berks. 21 Stephen de Stallis quit-claims to W., and sir William of Huntingdone, prior, in free alms, 6d. rent from pasture held by
Robert de Luches in Portmonfeld in W. Witnesses: Alexander Dublet, Robert de Luches, Nicholas and Alexander de Stallis, …, Peter the vintner, William vicar of Holy Trinity Wallingford, William the esquire. c. 1240–1254.

MS. Ch. Berks. 27 Robert Louches grants to W. in free alms a certain pasture of 5 acres in Portfelde. Witnesses: Eustace the goldsmith, mayor, Nicholas son of Simon, Hubert Hatfeld, Nicholas the clerk, Nicholas the chaplain of S. Mary, Simon Hous. c. 1260–70.

MS. Ch. Berks. 30 John son of Hugh of Brehull, with the assent of Nicholaa his wife, grants to Alan of W., physician, his fish-pond (32 feet in length) at the East Gate. Rent: 2d. For this Alan has given him one mark. Witnesses: Alexander Dublet, mayor, master Peter of Benham, Nicholas the goldsmith, John Robechild, Ranulf the goldsmith, Stephen de Stallis, Jordan the goldsmith, [], William the clerk. c. 1250–1265.

MS. Ch. Berks. 39 Geoffrey son of Robert de aula grants to W. 5 acres of land with meadow lying between the land of Kuth his brother and the land of Hubert of Hethfeld, paying 6d. to the lord of the fee. Also with his body he grants to them in free alms a messuage between the house of William Barat and that of Ralph Cruday. Witnesses: Ralph of Mackeneie and William his brother, John of Sotwelle and John his son, Henry bahstarius, Hubert of Hethfelde, Ralph [de Stallis?], Walter Bacun, Robert of …, Walter of Leccon’. c. 1260–c. 1270.

MS. Ch. Berks. 43 Hubert of Hethfeld grants to W. in free alms rents of 5/6 from half a virgate and ½ one acre of land which Henry de Furno holds, lying by Northmulle, in Weyforlong, Thistelforlong, and Monekedene—a total of acres—for the upkeep of a candle weighing two pounds to burn before the image of St. Mary in the south part of the church of the Holy Trinity, during the celebration of mass, and whenever anyone else bums a candle there. Witnesses: Sir Richard de Turri, steward of the honour. Sir Henry de scaccario, Sir Robert Bryand, master John of Pesemer, master John of Tyvener, William son of Simon, Alexander Dublet.This looks like a 14th century deed, but the attestation of Alexander Dublet requires a date before 1265, when he died leaving a son and heir John. It may be a transcript or a forgery. This looks like a 14th century deed, but the attestation of Alexander Dublet requires a date before 1265, when he died leaving a son and heir John. It may be a transcript or a forgery.

MS. Ch. Berks. 56 Richard Gratard, son of Roger Gratard, grants to Richard Louches of W. the plot with the barbican by the West Gate of W., also a plot outside the West Gate, to build on at pleasure. Witnesses: Robert of Sottewelle, Nicholas de la Barre, Nicholas of Medforde, John Maryot, John atte Forteye, junior, Swayn of Morteleye, Robert Boneface. Given at W. 28 March 1314.

MS. Ch. Berks. 121 John Mannyng, clerk, grants to Henry Deme of W. and Elene his wife all the lands and rents &c. which he and John Hogecote had in W. and C. Witnesses: Richard ate Felde, mayor, John James, Nicholas Tannare, Roger Mulbone, Roger Arniat. Given at W. 4th … 1378–9.

MS. Ch. Berks. 131 Robert Haward of W., and Magote his wife, grant to master Geoffrey Prentys, John Kyng, chaplain, Richard Wysebeche, and John Herdyngtone, clerk, a messuage and garden in All Saints’, between Hunstrete on the north and a croft called le Komynger late of Robert James on the south, one end abutting on the high way opposite the castle towards the east, the other abutting on the said croft towards the west, which the grantors had of the gift of William Noke, rector of S. Peter’s, W., and Ralph Horsyngtone, clerk. Witnesses: John Derby, mayor, John Coterelle, William Amyat, Richard Horlok, aldermen, Robert Defhunt, Robert Perot, bailiffs, John Chalonere. Given at W. 19 July. 1411.

MS. Ch. Berks. 136 John Kyng, chaplain, and John Hudyngton grant a messuage and garden [as in no. 131] to John Tylton, John Waleys, and John Lycchefeld, chaplains, John Mason, and Thomas Perucote. Witnesses: John Warfelde, mayor, William Borde, Laurence Haweman, William Motte, Richard Colles, Richard Dalgate, William Bodyngtone. Given at W. 13 Jan. 1431.It is actually dated Friday, the feast of S. Hilary, 9 Hen. VI, but in that year the feast of S. Hilary fell upon a Saturday.

MS. Ch. Berks. 137 The grantees of no. 136 grant to John Warfeld, senior, (i) the same messuage, (ii) Also a croft called le Conynger’ [i.e. the Warren] between the le Castelstrete on the East, and Bothecrofte on the West, one end abutting on Hundstrete and Henry Deme’s
garden towards the north, the other abutting on the garden late of Richard Tonworth, chaplain, on the south, which they lately had of the gift of John Kyng, chaplain. Witnesses: William Marmyon esq., John Warfeld, mayor, William Bodyngtone, Richard Dalgate, aldermen, John Hertt, Thomas Thornelle, bailiffs. 13 Feb. 1437.

MS. Ch. Berks. 26 John Huberd of W. grants to W. in free alms a messuage in Symeones Lane, in the parish of Holy Trinity, between the messuage of Geoffrey the carpenter, and that late of Hugh the miller, for which the monks used to pay him 4d. Witnesses: Richard of Brytweltune, mayor, Eustace [C]lement, Nicholas the goldsmith, William Blonne, Richard de la Wyke, William de la Wyke, Peter Le Ster, William le Ster, John de Basinge. c. 1270–c. 1280.

MS. Ch. Berks. 29 John Ferarius of W. grants to Henry of Yaunewith, for 14/- already paid, a messuage in the parish of Holy Trinity, W., between Hubert Hatfeld’s messuage on the north … Rent: 10d. to the lord of the fee (i.e. to the chamberlain of Holy Trinity) and 1d. to John and his heirs. Witnesses: Alexander Dublet, mayor, Nicholas de Stallis, Richard of Bristewaltone, Robert de Louches, master Peter of Benham, Alexander de Stallis, Alan the doctor, John the clerk. [Mutilated.] c. 1255–1265.

MS. Ch. Berks. 31 [] widow of Walter Vergeley quit-claims to John Vyne her right in a messuage in the parish of Holy Trinity, in Kanecroft, and M. rent from a plot by this tenement. Witnesses: Alexander de Stallis, mayor, … Peter le Palefreur and Nicholas Herui, bailiffs. [Mutilated.] c. 1260–c. 1270.

MS. Ch. Berks. 53 William le Coveror of W. grants to Richard de Louches of W., a messuage and curtilage in the parish of Holy Trinity, between the messuage late of Simon of Sartrya and that late of Ralph of Ruycote. Witnesses: John Maryot, mayor, Simon of Heyworth, John le Gredere, Thomas of Berewyk, Robert Boneface. Given at W. 26 Feb. 1310.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 33 Indenture by which Richard son and heir of John de Louches of Wallingford grants to John le Gr[e]dere of W. one acre of land in
Clopcote called Bataylacre, between Osbert of Notele’s land and that of Robert de Meleburne, extending from the north to the south in la Westwey, for a certain piece of land with buildings in W., in the parish of Holy Trinity, by Corteyslane. Witnesses: Robert of Meleburne, Richard de curru, Osbert of Notele, Henry Ywon, William de Meleburne, Alan of Clopcote, Gilbert of Maundeville, Richard West, William le Feron, clerk. 28 March 1307.

MS. Ch. Berks. 58 Joan Corteys of W., widow grants to Thomas of Berewyk and Isabella his wife, a plot of land between her cottages in Corteyslane on the east side; 35 feet in width to the curtilege of Eustace the goldsmith towards the east and reaching Corteyslane on the north, 55 feet long; in the parish of Holy Trinity. Witnesses: John Maryot, mayor, Richard de Touches, Simon of Heyworth, and Roger Badecok, aldermen, Thomas Bone, Eustace the goldsmith, John de Louches, Robert Boneface. Given at W. 24 June 1318.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 34 William Curteys of Wallingeforde quit-claims to Thomas de Berewyke and Isabella his wife his right in a piece of land reaching in length from the piece which they had of the gift of Joan Curteys his mother in Curteyselane, to the curtilage of the said Joan on the west—7½ feet; and in width from the curtilage of the said Joan on the south to the tenement of Thomas de Horspathe on the north—20 feet, in the parish of Holy Trinity, Wallingford. Witnesses: John Mariot, mayor of W., Richard de Touches, Simon of He}nvorth, and Roger Badecok, aldermen, Thomas Bone, John de Touches, and Robert Boneface. Given at W. 23 July 1318. Seal, ⅔” long, in green wax, in the shape of a shield:’ 1 (or T)ELS’: a bird (long-billed) sitting on a nest.

MS. Ch. Berks. 65 A charter to the same effect as 66, and in the same hand; the only additional information is that Th. of B.’s tenement was on the West and Richard de Touches’ curtilage on the East. Witnesses: the same. 21 Oct. 1320.

MS. Ch. Berks. 66 Joan Corteys, widow, daughter and heiress of William Corteys of W., quit-claims to Thomas of Berewyk of W., her right in a tenement in the parish of Holy Trinity, W., between the garden of Richard de Louches and the tenements of Eustace the
goldsmith and the said Thomas, in Corteyslane. Witnesses: Nicholas de la Barre, mayor, Swayn of Mortele, Richard de Louches, Thomas Bone, John de Louches, Thomas le Noble, Robert Boneface, clerk. Given at W. 22 Oct. 1320.

MS. Ch. Berks. 80 John son of Thomas of Berewyk of W., junior, grants to John of Berewyk, his elder brother, two granges, a well, and a curtilage in the parish of Holy Trinity, between the principal tenement late of Thomas of B., on the east, in S. Mary the Greater, and the garden of Richard le Louches on the west, reaching Curteyslane [on the north], and the tenement late of Robert de Ossyndene and the tenement of Alice, widow of … [on the south]. Witnesses: Richard Moryn, mayor, John Whytyng, Thomas Heruy, John le Gredere, Peter Restwolde, Robert of Toppesfelde, clerk. Given at W. 21 July 1335.

MS. Ch. Berks. 20 b Stephen de Stallis grants to the Hospital of St. John, W., in free alms, a corner messuage in the parish of St. Leonard’s, by the messuage formerly of Henry of Medford, opposite the messuage of Bartholomew Fryburne within the South Gate of W. Rent: 12d. to the fee farm of W., and a clove gilly flower to the grantor. Witnesses: Alexander de Stallis, mayor, Richard of Britwalton, master Peter of Benham, William Blawe, Eustace Clem[ent], John Hynner, Richard Mariot, bailiffs. c. 1230–c. 1240. The whole is excellently preserved. In the fold of the parchment at the bottom is, in Wood’s hand: ’Given to me by Dr. Tob: Garbrand a° 1664. Ant: Woode.’ See Life, ed. Clark, ii. 19.

MS. Ch. Berks. 40 Richard le [Wyth]ebolterSo in Coxe and Turner’s catalogue: the deed is now torn. with the assent of Lynina his wife, grants to Robert of Cuxham and Norgana his wife, for 4 marks of silver, a messuage and curtilage between the messuage of Simon Molle and that of Peter Henthelon’ in St. Leonard’s, W. Rent: ½d. to the Hospital of St. John, 1d. to Eustace Clement and his heirs, 2/- to the priory of W. Witnesses: Nicholas the goldsmith, mayor, Richard of Brytwaltone, Eustace son of Clement, William de Wyck, William Alan, John de Basinges, Walter Scympeyn, reeves, John Hyne, John de Luchiis, then clerk, ’et aliis cum toto burgemot’. c. 1270–c. 1280.

MS. Ch. Berks. 83 Indenture by which the prior &c. of W. lease to Richard le Irmonger and Juliana his wife, for 7 years, a tenement with the houses thereon near the cemetery of St. Martin’s. Rent 4s. 6d. Witnesses: Richard Moryn, mayor, John Mariot, John of Blebury, John le gredare, Richard Gratard, William of Meleburn. Given at W. 21 Dec. 1336.

MS. Ch. Berks. 118 Roger Cole of W., grants to Henry Redynge and Richard Coket of Abingdon a tenement with curtilage adjacent in S. Martin’s, between the messuage of Thomas Horspathe on the south, in which Nicholas Kyng lives, and the garden of Roger Milburne on the north. Witnesses: Thomas Benshef, mayor, Richard ate Felde, Nicholas Tannere, Roger Arniat, Robert Botty. Given at W. 9 Aug. 1377.

MS. Ch. Berks. 50 Matilda, widow of Richard of Morton quit-claims to John de Luchiis and Eve his wife, for ½ a mark, her right in 10d. rent from part of a tenement which Henry of Duolesdene held in the parish of St. Mary the Greater, between the tenement late of William Lorimer and that late of Richard Gratard. Witnesses: Thomas Hykon, Henry of Appelford, Ralph of Boneye, aldermen, William de la Wyk, Nicholas Clement’, John Hyne, John le Berner, William the lorimer, John of Meleburne, John Bone, Gregory of Watham, Thomas Champeneys, Thomas Costard, Gilbert of Mandevile, and Henry Folyot, bailiffs. 6 Dec. 1287.

MS. Ch. Berks. 85 William Badecok of W. grants to John Cary of W. and Joan his wife a tenement, which he had of the gift of Thomas son and heir of Thomas of Berewyk, in S. Mary the Greater, between the messuage of Agnes widow of John atte Dene on the south, and that of Robert Boty on the north, reaching the highway on the west above the messuage of the said R. B. Witnesses: John Maryot, Richard Moryn, John Whytyng, Robert Boty, John atte Rysshe, William Foerthyng, Robert of Toppesfeld, clerk. Given at W. 18 Jan. 1341.

MS. Ch. Berks. 115 John Teytfott of Tondon grants to Alice Foliot of W. two messuages in S. Mary the Greater, Wallingford, a curtilage in Canecroft,
and 2½ acres of land in Croozmersche Giffard (Oxon.). Witnesses: Richard ate Felde, mayor, John James, William Harewelle, William Spoute (?), Alexander Job. Given at W. 17 June 1371.

MS. Ch. Berks. 116 Alice Foliot of W. grants to Reginald Wylder, chaplain, and Richard Redeford, a tenement in W., between John Poulyn’s tenement on the south, and Denis Lane on the north. Witnesses: Thomas Benecheff, mayor, Nicholas Tannere, Roger Melborne, Dorkyn (?), aldermen, Richard ate Felde, Thomas Grove, Roger Druyet, Roger Cole, Henry Redynge, Thomas Reginald, clerk. Given at W. 18 Aug. 1375.

MS. Ch. Berks. 119 Alice Foliot of W. grants to Sir John Kentwode, kt., John Arblaster and Henry Maundevile a tenement in W., between that of John Poulyn on the south and Denyseslane, on the north, reaching from the high road to Wodestret, which she had of the gift of Reginald Bulde Ro rector of St. Mary’s, W., and Richard Bedford, chaplain, for life, with reversion to heir, heirs and assigns, after the death of William Lytfot and Joan his wife. Witnesses: John Bencheff, mayor, Richard ate Felde, Nicholas Tannere, Henry Radynge, aldermen, Roger Milborne, Roger Druyat, Roger Cole, William Cary, Thomas Grove, John Lerkyn, Thomas Reynald. Given at W. Thurs. before S. Laurence, Ric. II.

MS. Ch. Berks. 130 Richard Horlok of W. grants to Robert Haward and Magote his wife tenement in the parish of St. Mary the Greater, with half a grange and a garden adjacent, between Thomas Chapman’s tenement on the south, and Folyatlane on the north, reaching from the high road on the west to Wodestret on the east. Rent 20/-. Witnesses: John Derby, mayor, John Cotterel, William Arnyat, aldermen, William Essex, John Hert, John Denby, William Megre, William Moite. Given at W. 10 March 1410.

MS. Ch. Berks. 133 Robert Dunham and Joan his wife quit-claim to John Pape junior of W. this right in a messuage and garden in S. Mary the Greater, between the messuage of William Essex on the east, and the garden of the Hospital of St. John the Baptist on the south. Witnesses: Richard Horloke, mayor, John Coterell, William Arniat, John Derby, aldermen, William Moite, John Denby, bailiffs, … William Coterelle. Given at W. 26 May 1415.

MS. Ch. Berks. 138 Robert [] of W., chandler, quit-claims to the prior &c. of W., a tenement in S. Mary the Greater, between the tenement of Robert Hyndeman on either side, facing the castle: the garden lies between … on the east, and Goldesmithes tenement on the west. 15 July 1447.

MS. Ch. Berks. 54 Alice and Joan, daughters and heiresses of Bartholomew of Henlee of W., grant to Richard de Louches, son and heir of John, a house in the parish of St. Mary the Less, W., between the houses of the prior &c. of W. on either side. Witnesses: John Maryot, mayor, Ralph le Taverner, Gilbert of Maundeville, and William le Feron, aldermen, Sweyn of Mortele, Simon of Heyworth, Robert of Bedewynde, and Nicholas of Tomestone, reeves, ’et multis aliis cum toto burgomoto’. 11 July 1309.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 35 Robert Freman de Cestria, burgess of Wallingford, grants to Henry le Bacheler of Basyng’ and Agnes his wife, for 20/- the messuage which he had of the gift of Stephen de Stallis, lying between the messuage of William de Stallis, chaplain, and that of Ernald Boneface, in the parish of St. Peter’s, Wallingford, 22 feet in width: in length it stretches from the highroad to the outer barbican of the castle ditch. Rent: (i) to the sacristan of Holy Trinity, Wallingford, 3/1, and (ii) to the fee farm of the borough 2/-, and (iii) to the heirs of Stephen de Stallis a pound of cummin. Witnesses: Thomas de Chausee, mayor of W., William of Muleburne, Richard of …ham, Henry of Hastings, and John le Gredere, bailiffs. Given at W. 20 March 1294. Pointed oval seal, 1¼”; an ornament: S’ · ROB’ · LE · CHAPMAN.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 36 Ralph son of Hugh de Stratford, forester, grants to Henry son of Robert two messuages with houses &c., which he had of the gift of William son of Richard the miller of Burtone, in the town of Buckingham, lying at la Hulle, between the abbot of Butlesdene’s messuage and that late of Richard Musard. Rent: 8d., and 7d. to William son of Richard of Burton. For this grant Henry gave him 3½ marks. Witnesses: Sir Ralph Harang, Sir Hugh de
Castilun, Sir William fitz-Reginald, kts., Berner of Horew[ode], William of Thame, Henry the butcher, Hugh of Sybeforde, Laurence Perte, Roger Wygesoule, Hugh le Taylur, William le Taylur. c. 1260.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 37 Richard of Grimescote grants to St. L., in free alms, a croft near the hedge belonging to the Hospital (sepes infirmorum) ’and one acre’ lying over Sugkewrche in Hafdelond above the acre held from the Hospital in lancetagium (infirmorum lancet’). Witnesses: Ralph of Grimescote, Robert of Culewrthe, Simon of Cropiri, William of Prestecote, William of Selvestone. 1150–70.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 38 Richard son of Anselm of Grimescote grants to St. L. in free alms land in C. which they formerly held from him at farm, i.e. (i) the land once held by Walter son of John in villeinage, (ii) a virgate which Ailwyn once held from the grantor in villeinage. Witnesses: Sir Thomas de Arderne of Hanewelle, Sir John fitz-Guydo, Hugh of Bereford, Walter le honorable, Simon of Cropp’, master Thomas of Molintone, William his brother, Lawrence of Herdewic, Nicholas of Palsynton, John Waudard, Henry Gadone. c. 1210–c. 1220.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 39 Richard de Grimescote et de Cleydone grants to the same in free alms a messuage with croft in Cleydone which John le Capiere once held from him. Witnesses: Hugh de Bereford, John Cachelewe, Walter le Honorable, master Thomas de Molintone. c. 1260–70. Broken seal as in M. 40.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 40 Richard de Grimescote grants to St. Mary and St. Leonard’s, Clattercote, in free alms, a virgate of land and a messuage in Cleydon, which Robert son of Aldewin once held from him. Witnesses: Sir Robert de Wycham, Simon de Cropray, John Cachelen, Hugh de Berford, Anselm de Grimescote. 1260–70. Pointed oval seal, 1¼ × ⅞”, in brown wax; a heron in flight, with something in its mouth: S’ · RICARDI · DE · GRIMESCOTE.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 41 Richard de Grimescote son of Anselm de Grimescote grants to the same in free alms, (i) one virgate of arable land in Cleydon, which Henry le Hunte once held from him; (ii) and a messuage with a croft, lying between the prior’s land and the road to the church, which William Faber once held from him; (iii) all his right in the land called Presteshurne. Witnesses: Simon de Croprey, John Catheleu, Anselm de Grimescote, Henry the marshal, Gilbert de Walecote. c. 1260–70. Seal as in M. 40. This charter is written in the same hand as no. 32.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 42 Henry Faber of Farneberge grants to the same, in free alms, Richard son of Walter Sweterich of Cleydon, with all his issue and chattels, whom the grantor bought back from Richard fitz-Anselm de Grimescote. Witnesses: Nicholas de Say, John Kachelewe, Alexander de Wulfeye, Richard fitz-Symon de Bradewelle, Robert de Aubundele, clerks, Richard de la Dene, Robert de Leueland, Stephen the baker. c. 1240–c. 1250. Circular seal, 11/4″ in red wax, a fleur-de-lys, SIGILL’ · HENRICI · LEFEVERE.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 43 Henry called the Marshal of Farneberi grants to the same, in free alms, a messuage and a virgate of land in Claydon, which he had of the gift of Richard de Grimmescote, namely the virgate which Richard Atteyate once held from R. de G. in villeinage. Witnesses : Sirs John Passelewe, John Peche, knights, Jordan de Say, lord of Farneberi, Walter le Honurable, Henry Mile of Chaddeleshunt, Anselm de Grimmescote, William Gyffarde of Wirmelectone. c. 1260–70.
Radcliffe [Bucks.].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 44 William Foliot, senior, of Evenele [Evenley, N’hants.], grants to Ralph Harang of Radeclef a messuage with a garden, 20 acres of arable land, 10 acres of meadow, and 15 acres of pasture which Nigel his father bought from Odo Borewater of Radeclef, in R. and Schekem, lying between Ralph Harang’s messuage on the south and the manse of John le Catur on the north, [boundaries specified]. Witnesses: Symon, abbot of Betlesdene [Biddlesden],
William de Evenesholte, Walter Bastarde, Ralph Porcel, R. his son, Robert de Bayntone, Walter Cotus, Yvo Cotusforde, Roger his brother, Ralph Langeporthe. This is a late fourteenth-century transcript. Simon, abbot of Biddlesden does not occur in V.C.H. Bucks, i. 367.

div.head: Ravenstone Priory (Bucks.)
div.p: Bucks, chs. 1–37 refer to Ravenstone. Of these the following are fully dealt with in the Calendar of Charters and Rolls in the Bodleian Library, and have therefore been omitted: nos. 2 (p. 28), 9–12 (p. 29), 17–20 (p. 30), 22 (p. 30), 30 (p. 32), 31 (p. 31), 35–7 (p. 31.)

MS. Ch. Bucks 1) John de Basingham, lord of Wahull,John inherited the estate in 1238 and died in 1239. (V.C.H. Bucks. iv. 441.) grants to William the clerk for his homage and service, a messuage near the cemetery, and 3 acres of land in R. Rent: 3/-. Witnesses: Hugh de Legh, Ralph de Parentin, William (?) de R[ave]nestone, Simon of R., Walter Caperon, Ralph his son, William son of []†, Walter the cook. c. 1238–9.

MS. Ch. Bucks 3 Agnes, daughter of Walter the cook, grants to sir William prior &c. of R., in free alms 1½ acres of land in R. viz. that acre lying in the upper shot nearer the ditch which is between the assart of the heirs of Walter the cook and the assart of the heirs of Richard Tonge. Rent:3d. For this grant the prior gave 16s. 8d. Witnesses: Sir Walter de insula, kt., master John de Chishulle, Sir John de St. Maria, William and Simon de R., William de Nodariis, Nicholas the clerk, Nicholas of Haversham, Henry the mason, Walter of Scrintun. 1254–c. 1260.
MS. Ch. Bucks 4 The same grant, with the addition of a ditch and hedge. Rent, the same. For this grant the prior gave 24s. 8d. Witnesses: the same.

MS. Ch. Bucks 5 Richard Tonge of R. grants to Walter the cook, for his homage and service and for 30/-, 2½ acres of land with a ditch and hedge. Rent: 4d. Witnesses: . . . . . . . [de Rave]nestone, William of Luttone, Walter Caperun, Ralph his son, William the chamberlain, Helias of Cugeho. c. 1260.

MS. Ch. Bucks 6a John son of Richard Tonge of R. grants to R. the same ditch and hedge [lying as in 3]. Witnesses: master John de Chishulle, Sir John de St. Maria, William de Nodariis, William of R., William of Dudingtune, Simon of R., Walter of Scrintune, William Ailward, Nicholas the clerk, Henry the mason. 1254–c. 1260.

MS. Ch. Bucks 6b Richard de Clifford, rector of R., grants to William of R. and Christiana his wife the messuage which Edmund formerly held of the fee of the church of R. Witnesses: Sir William of Divises, then prior of R., Sir Michael chaplain of R., Nicholas the clerk of R., John Tonge, Walter of Schyrintone, William Caperun, John the clerk, Richard Facceneie. c. 1260.

MS. Ch. Bucks 8 Elizabeth, daughter of William of R., grants to R. 7 acres of land in R. which were formerly of Walter [], near the great park, in the shot called Walt’ stocking Thone. Witnesses: Sir Roger de Chiringham, kt., Almaric de Nodariis, kt., John of … wile, Robert [of Crettone], [Edward] of Devisis, William the cook. c. 1290–1302.
MS. Ch. Bucks 7 Quit-claim for the same. Same witnesses. In the same hand.

MS. Ch. Bucks 9 Nicholas, son of Richard Tonge of R., quit-claims to R. all that he held of them, viz. (i) a messuage and croft in R., (ii) all his land in the assart called Thongestocking, (iii) also 4d. rent from 1½ ac. held by William Caperun, 5d. from 1 ac. held by Matilda Thebaud, 1d. from Nicholas son of John for two strips, ¼d. from Robert the chamberlain for part of a messuage. Witnesses: Sir William de Nodariis, kt., Ahnaric his son, John of Morewelle, William Caperun of R., Edward of R. c. 1290–1302.

MS. Ch. Bucks 13 William of R. grants to Beatrice his daughter, for her homage and service, that assart with hedges and ditches which he bought from Hugh son of the reeve. Rent: 2s. 0½d. Witnesses: William Caperun, [R]ic[hard] son of Thomas of R., Richard s · cce … William the cook, Nicholas Thonge. c. 1270–80.

MS. Ch. Bucks 14 Indenture by which R … d, prior &c. of R. grants to Simon of R., chaplain, the assart which they had from Nicholas Tonge of
R., in the meadow of R., and which Hugh Ode held, for 12 years from the feast of St. Clement. Rent: 9/-. Witnesses: William of R., Robert then chaplain, William Caperun, Edward of R., Richard Faccen’, Richard of Weston, William the cook. 1280–90.

MS. Ch. Bucks 16 Edith, daughter of William Aylward, quit-claims to R. ½ acre of land in ’Cline hul’. Witnesses: Sir Almaric de Nodariis, and Roger de [?Chiringham], kts., John of . . rwelle of Stoke Goldingtone, William Caperun of R., William the cook of R. Given at R. 18 July 1297.

MS. Ch. Bucks 15 Henry de castro of R. demises to Hugh Ode of the same and Isabella his wife … lying at Petronwelle between the land of Henry Randolf and that of William Cok, for their lives. Rent: 6s. 6d. Witnesses: Richard le spicer, Robert . . . ., Robert le Cok. Given at R. [Mutilated.] 30 Sept. 1291.

MS. Ch. Bucks 21 Thomas of Lyford and Joan his wife grant to Philip Tone of R. and Matilda his wife, all that they held in R. Witnesses: John of R., Thomas de Cretone, Simon de Cretone, … Alurich of R. Given at R. . . 9 Ed. II.

MS. Ch. Bucks 23 Alice relict of John of R., grants to Philip Tone of R. and Alice his wife 2 acres 1½roods of land in R. Witnesses: sir Richard perpetual vicar of R., Henry le spicer of R., Nicholas the smith of R., John B …, Philip Alurich. Given at R. 22 Oct. 1320.

MS. Ch. Bucks 24 Henry of Warewik and Christiana his wife grant to Walter Wydmot of R. and Beatrice his wife and Joan their daughter a rood of arable land in R. between the prior’s land and that of Elizabeth daughter of John of R. Witnesses: John of Liforde, William of L., Henry Lespicer of R., Henry de Noers, Simon de Cretone. Given at R. 29 July 1324.

MS. Ch. Bucks 25 Henry of Warewyk in R. and Christiana his wife grant to Ely of Weston in R. 6 acres of land in R. Witnesses: William de Nodariis, John de Haregrave, Henry son of Simon of Westone, John de Lyvorde, Simon de Cretone, Henry le spicer, Nicholas the smith, Philip Tone, Henry of Westone. Given at R. 6 Aug. 1324.

MS. Ch. Bucks 26 Henry of Mulsho [Moulsham] of R. grants to sir Richard of R. chaplain, one acre one rood of arable land and two roods of meadow in … one acre of land in Scyttho near the land which William Gyle holds of sir William de Mokelstone, kt. Witnesses: [] de Noers, Hugh de Warewyk, William of Lyford, Robert le Kong of R., Richard lespecer of R. [Mutilated.] … 4 Ed. III.

MS. Ch. Bucks 27 Alice [] grants to sir Robert, prior &c. of R., 3½ acres in the fields and meadows of . . . . for her life with reversion to Nicholas her husband, and on his death remainder to the said prior &c. Witnesses: Henry Lespicer of R., Richard Le specer of R., Robert …, William of Lyforde. Given at R. 23 Sept. 1333.

MS. Ch. Bucks 28 Joane Adecok, widow of Roger Ingelberd of Northampton, grants to John le Masun of R. clerk, one acre of arable land … Weston at ’Le Smale hegges,’ near the abbot of Lavenden’s land. Witnesses: Henry le spicer of R., Nicholas le [] of R., Philip Alurich of R., Robert Alewey of R. Given at R. [Mutilated.] 1 Nov. 1337.

MS. Ch. Bucks 29 The same is bound to pay the same 30/- in the church of R. at the feast of Epiphany following. Witnesses: Henry of Warewyk, William of Leyford, Robert the cook, John le gros, Richard le specer. Given at R. 5 Nov. 1337.

MS. Ch. Bucks 32 Henry, son of William de castro, grants to Hugh Ode of R. one [… after rood of arable land lying at le ‘Peretrewelle’. Witnesses: Nicholas the smith of R., Robert Alewey, John Lawrence, Philip Alurich. Given at R. … after 7 Oct. 1341.

MS. Ch. Bucks 34 William of Haregrave of Stoke Goldington, chaplain, grants to R. all his inheritance in Stoke, Ikelee, Pyddington and Weston, with a messuage and 30 acres of land which he had of the gift of Nicholas the smith of R. Witnesses: Thomas de Rayms, Simon Northwich, William de Nowers, Roger …, … son of John, Robert Alewey … Given at Stoke Goldington. 14 Aug. 1350.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 45 William called the Young of Weston grants William his son 3 acres of land in W., of which 1 acre lies in the south field above Longecroft, at the cross called Walter’s, between William
Swirthing’s land and that of Martin Blund, and 2 acres lie in the north field—one in Stenewelleforlong, between William Pynant’s land and that of Robert Aunfray, the other in Northlongforlong, between John Sybile’s land and that of … Rent: a rose at midsummer. For this William (the son) gave 2/-. Witnesses: Sir Roger Damar’, kt., Sir Ralph de Cestertone, kt., Sir Richard called the Poor (Le Poer) kt., Robert the Young of W., William de Millington, Philip the clerk. [Torn.] c. 1270.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 46 Henry the Mason of Ravenestone grants to Thomas his son, for his service, ½ acre of land in R., lying in land called Goderode, between the land late of Henry Ascelene and that of Walter Aluerhic, abutting at one head on the land of John fitz-William de R., and at the other on the croft late of William Aylward. Rent: 1d. and forinsec service. Witnesses: Walter de R., John his brother, William Caperun, Walter Jurdan, Edward de Divisis, Nicholas Thonge, Thomas the chamberlain. c. 1280–1300.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 47 Indenture by which John de R. grants to Philip Tone of R. and Alice, the grantor’s daughter, in free marriage all the lands and tenements in R. which he had of the gift of Philip Tone. Witnesses: Nicholas the smith of R., Henry the apothecary of the same, Philip Alurich, Nicholas Golone, Walter the cook. Given at R. 25 Nov. 1329.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 48 Indenture by which John Golone of R. and Alice his wife grant to Hugh Ode of the same and Isabella his wife, and Henry le Fullere and Agnes his wife, an acre of land in R. between Walter Tone’s land and that of Henry Eve (or Ene) at Fonleslow. Rent: a rose at Midsummer, for 12 years, and after that 13/-. Witnesses: Henry de … Robert Alewey, Philip Alrich, Richard le spicer, Nicholas le smyth. Given at R. 3 Oct. 1344.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 49 Indenture by which Richard Gateman of R. grants to Hugh Ode of R. and Isabella his wife 6 strips and pasture at the head of each, lying in the great croft by the land of Nicholas le smyth in three places of the same croft, for 13 years from Michaelmas, 20 Ed. III. Half the fruits are to go to the grantors, who may resume possession if the land is left uncultivated. Witnesses: Robert Alewey, Henry de castro, Richard Spicer, John le Feroner (?), John Laurence. Given at R. 29 Sept. 1346.
Shalstone [Bucks.].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 50 Walter son of William the carter of Saldistone grants to William the clerk, his brother, of Westburi, for his service and for a house which he bought from Peter, late the son of Richard Franceis of Westburi, a piece of land lying between the grantee’s land on either side, and reaching to the house of Richard le Pape: thirty feet by twenty feet: with half a strip over Brerforlong by le Wodewei, reaching over Flexlond. Witnesses: Ralph of Senliz, Jordan Bastard, Thomas Rikeward, Robert Hardel, William the palmer, John the clerk, William the clerk. c. 1230–40.

MS. Ch. Essex 193) and M. 51 Matilda, relict of William Seburc of Fordham, grants to Richard de Ewell of the same, for 40/-, a field with hedges and ditches, called Haukeslond, and a path, in the parish of Great Fordham. Rent: 2/-. Witnesses: John Chaucie, William Pol, Walter Bichedun, Ralph son of Agnes, John his son, Richard Boli, Stephen the cook, John son of William, John his son. Given at Fordham. 17 May 1349. Endorsed, ’Carta de 4 acris terre vocatis Haukeslond … quas Robertus Hoolde modo tenet in anno 8 Ric. II.’
Totham [Essex].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 52 Bartholomew the cook, of Totham, grants to Ivo fitz-Gilbert for his homage and service, (i) that croft in T. called ’Tuong’ [or Twonge’ in M. 53.] which lies between the road and Symon son of Anselm’s land; (ii) one acre of land in the field called Pirifield, lying along the road, shut in by a ditch. Rent: 6d., also the service due to the King, and for scutage 1½d. For this grant Ivo gave 5/-. Witnesses: Bartholomew de la more, Roger de Vneseia, Roger the palmer, Henry the clerk, Gilbert fitz-Thomas, Nigel de Sireburne, John Ballard, Walter fitz-Gilbert, Richard the clerk of Totham. c. 1230–40. Circular seal, 1¼”, attached by cord of green and white silk. A hammer? SIGILL · BERTELUY · LE · CV[K].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 53 Cristina and Emma, daughters of the late Bartholomew the cook of T., confirm M. 52. For this Ivo gave them 3/-. Witnesses: Bartholomew de la More, Roger de Vneseia, Roger le paumer, Henry the clerk, Gilbert fitz-Thomas, John de Sirebume, Robert
Folenfant, Walter fitz-Gilbert, William de Chiselford, Richard de Totham, clerk. c. 1240–50. Pointed oval seal, broken, ’S’ · CRIST … BART’·’; an ornament.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 54 Ivo fitz-Gilbert grants to Richard de Withermundeford for his homage and service, all the land which he held from Bartholomew the cook in T. Rent: 6d. to the heirs of B. the c. and scutage 1½d. For this Richard gave 8/-. Witnesses: Bartholomew de la more, Philip de Bovile, Robert Folenfant, William de Musters, Hugh the forester, Gilbert of Totham, John of Syreburne, Walter the janitor, Amald of Colne, clerk. c. 1250–60.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 55 Simon de Barnaville grants to the same, for his homage and service and a mark of silver, a piece of land in Great Totham, between the land late of Bartholomew de la more, and that of Amicia de Shereburne, abutting on the road which stretches from John Ballard’s house to that of B. de le M. Rent: 1d., scutage, ½d. Witnesses: Sewal de Mora, John de Seymtawayn, Robert Folenfant, John de Shereburne, John Alard, Philip de Bovile, Robert de (Gibecralse?), Roger Anketil, Peter le paumer. c. 1260–70.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 56 William fitz-Gerald sells to Henry fitz-Robert, for 10/-, John son of Gilbert the small of Nortone, his villein, with all his issue and chattels. Witnesses: Gilbert fitz-Martin, Elyas de Drays, Roger fitz-Richard, John de Baiocis, Richard Frankel[eyn], William de Helydene, William vicar of Thorneberge, clerk. c. 1240–50.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 57 Licence to Tewkesbury, because Gilbert de Clare, earl of Gloucester and Hertford, the king’s nephew, was buried there, to appropriate the churches of Thornbury and Fayreford. Portion of great seal attached by cords of red and green silk. 20 Nov. 1314.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 58 Letters patent of Walter, bp. of Worcester, relating the many causes of the poverty of Theokesbury, and giving licence to appropriate the church of Thornbury, having due regard to the rights of the then rector, master Roger called the Marshal, and assessing the church at 26 marks a year. Given at London. 11 Feb. 1314. Portion of Walter’s seal attached by cord of pink silk.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 58a Another copy.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 59 Inspeximus of M. 58 by Walter, abp. of Canterbury. Given at Lambeth. 5 May. 1315. Seal attached by cord of pink silk.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 60 Walter, bishop of Worcester, assigns to the vicarage of Thornbury, which is worth 18 marks 10 shillings, the house once held by Zalibroun, as a vicarage house. The value to be made up to 25 marks in money or wax. The vicar is to pay for books, vestments, and other necessary ornaments, synodal fees to the Archdeacon, and 4 marks a year to the bishop, but is not to be responsible for the repair of the chancel. 12 Aug. 1315. Seals of bishop Walter, the abbot of T., and the convent of T. Endorsed with references to cases in chancery, A.D. 1750 and 1813.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 61 Confirmation by the prior and chapter of Worcester of M. 60. 5 Oct. 1315.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 62 Inspeximus by the prior and chapter of Christ Church, Canterbury of 16 Jan. 1317.
(i) M. 58.
(ii) Inspeximus of M. 58 by the prior and chapter of Worcester, dated 10 Kal, April 1314.)
(iii) Inspeximus of both (i) and (ii) by Walter, abp. of Canterbury, dated at Lambeth 5 Non, May, 1316. (The original of this is Gloucs. ch. 28). Fragment of seal of the chapter, attached by cords of green and brown silk.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 63 Inspeximus of M. 57, by Edward II. Given at Newcastle-on-Tyne. By writ of P.S. 15 June 1315. The great seal, broken, attached by cords of red and green silk.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 64 Confirmation of the church of Thornbury, by Simon, bp. of Worcester, consequent upon a visitation. Given at Hertleburi. 4 Feb. 1336.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 65 Indenture by which Richard, abbot of Tewkesbury leases to William Warde, lately of Everton (Gloucs.), Margery his wife, and
William and Thomas their sons, the manor of Little Compton, with certain lands called Byllandis, and a close called Taylershay, from the feast of the Annunciation last past for 40 years, if any of them shall live as long. Rent: £5/6/8. They are bound to the abbot in a bond of £20, of the same date, to keep the agreement. Given at Tewkesbury, in the chapter-house. 19 Sept. 1438.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 66 Letters of John, bp. of Worcester permitting John, abbot of Tewkesbury, to appropriate the church of Little Compton, paying ¾ to the bishop, and ¾ to the archdeacon of Gloucester, yearly. Given in his castle at Hertlebury. 26 May 1472. Confirmation of this by Robert, prior, and the chapter of Worcester. Given in the chapter-house. 29 May. Confirmation by John Seggden, S.T.P., archdeacon of Gloucester. Given at Bristol. 16 June. Fragments of their seals.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 67 Indenture by which John Abbot of T., leases to Richard Bolde of Little Compton, and Margery his wife, the manor of Little Compton for 24 years from this date. Rent: £5/6/8. 28 Sept. 1477.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 68 Indenture by which Richard, abbot of T., leases to master Thomas With, vicar of the church of Thornbury, John Pichare of the same, and Thomas and William his sons, and John Payne lately of Morton in the parish of Thornbury, the site of the rectory and all tithes &c. for 40 years, if they live as long. Rent: £40/2/,This has been inserted over an erasure. The rent is elsewhere mentioned as £44. and 2/-. If the rent is four weeks overdue they shall lose their rights. Given at T., in the chapter-house. 16 June 1482. Endorsed: as no. M. 60.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 69 Letters patent of William Grevell, sergeant at law, and Walter Rowdone, reciting a licence of Henry VII dated the 12 March ’anno regni sui decimo’ [nono] to themselves, and a certain … [M]ordaunt, kt., and granting the advowson of the church of Wottone under Egge (Gloucs.) to Tewkesbury. 12 July 1505.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 70 Confirmation of their possessions in the diocese of Worcester to T., by the bishop of Worcester. 20 Sept. 1520. The (i) parish church of T., with the chapels of Northampton,
Byshleye, Estchurch, Oxyndey, Tredyntone, Abbot’s Wasseborne, (ii) church of St. James, Bristol, with the chapels of Stapultone, Mangodesfelde, (iii) parish church of Marsfelde, (iv) parish churches of Ampney Sancte Crucis, of Thombury, of Fayrford, (v) church of Stanweye, with the chapels of Lemyngton, Stanley, (vi) priory of Derehurst, (vii) parish church of Estlache S. Andrew’s, (viii) parish church of Wotton under Egge, (ix) parish church of Preston upon Sture, (xi) parish church of Little Compton, (xi) all tithes of Fayrford, (xii) 2 parts of the tithes of Aldertone and Ayelesdone, (xiii) and of Lower Swale, (xiv) ½ tithes of the lordship of Whyghtfeld in the parish of Derehurst, (xv) all tithes of the lordship late of Frederick of Hodynton in the same, (xvi) tithes of one hide in Gretton in the parish of Winchcombe, (xvii) the greater tithes late of William Hersfeld in the parish of H.
(xviii) from the church of St. [not given] Bristol, 11/-
(xix) ” ” ” ” Holy Trinity, Bristol, 10/-
(xx) ” ” ” ” St. John ” 10/-
(xxi) ” ” ” ” SS. Philip and James, Bristol, 13/4
(xxii) ” ” ” ” S. Michael, Bristol, 4/-
S. Andrew, Bristol, 1 lb. of wax,
(xxiii) ” ” ” ” Estleche S. Andrew, 30/-
(xxiv) ” ” ” ” Shenyndone, 13/4
(xxv) ” ” ” ” A. . . creston, 4/-
(xxvi) ” ” ” ” Welleford, 20/-

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 71 Parchment roll (4 ms.) containing: m. 1. The rector’s court at Thornbury, 5 Jan. 1418. 1d. Blank 2. Court held 19 April, 1407. 2d. ” ” 22 June, 1411. 3 and 3d. Court held 12 May, 1419. 4. Rental of Thombury made 12 May, 1419, including Thornbury (total) 61/- Townhulle 48/- Schypwardende 4/- 4d. Blank.
Leigh [Kent].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 72 Roger de Frendesbery, rector of Leghe, grants to John Simon of Osprenge two crofts of land which he had of the gift of Henry de Shiptone late rector of Leghe; east, to the land of the prior of
Tonebregge; south, to a lane leading to the highroad which runs between the church and the bridge called Bittebregge, at the land of William de Kamkerst; west, to the land of Roger Connegod and that of Geoffrey le Tailur; north, to the highroad running from the church to a place called Hildenne. Given at la Leghe. Witnesses: Thomas Chaini, John de Heghlonde, John de Polle, Thomas de Mordenne, William de Dorkynghole, John de Dorkynghole, Geoffrey le Tailour. 22 Jan. 1349.
Speldhurst [Kent].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 73 Richard Farnhame of Speldhurst grants to Richard atte Twyzthe and Cristina his wife, heir of the said Richard, a piece of land called Westland at Farnhamme in the parish of Speldhurst (boundaries). Witnesses: John Rolfe, Thomas Tidyman, John Farnham, Laurence Giffrey, Adam Giffrey, Thomas Sandr’, Thomas Lambkyn. Given at Speldhurst. 2 Feb. 1374.
Strode and Frindsbury [Kent].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 74 Thomas Boydyn of Strode grants to Simon Boydyn of the same and John Cok of Frendesbury all his lands in the parishes of Strode and Frendesbury and elsewhere in the county of Kent. Witnesses: John de Scha · ele, Henry Munde, Richard Skodyntone, Roger Abbot, Roger Danyel. 4 Sept. 1420.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 75 A seventeenth-century transcript of an agreement between Boniface archbishop of Canterbury and the dean and canons of Lincoln, witnessing that when the see of Lincoln falls vacant the canons are to name three or four of their number and notify the abp., who will choose one of them, and arranging for the maintenance of privileges and distribution of income during a vacancy. At Lambeth. Witnesses: Stephen, archdeacon of Canterbury, Hugh de Mortemer, Peter de Assona, official of Canterbury, Peter de Lemonicis, subdean and chaplain, Pontius de Sablera, canon of Valence, Hugh de Mota, Michael, dean of arches, master Henry de Sandwich, archdeacon of Oxford, David of St. Frideswide archdeacon of Derby, Robert de Kas … archdeacon of Worcester, and masters John de Maidenestone, Roger de Cana, canons of Lincoln, Ralph de Streafflard, and Adam de Kyles. . . . . 22 May. 1261.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 76 Richard, abbot &c. of Nottleley (Bucks.) lease to John Longlond of Northe Wynchyndon, yeoman, a tenement in Friday Street, London, called ’the abbot of Nottleley is lodgyng’, in which Richard Fytthette dwelt, from Michaelmas next for 61 years. Rent: 20/-. 27 Sept. 1538.
[Middlesex.]

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 77 Richard Moryson esq., grants to William Elistone, merchant tailor of London, for £180, his manor of Bromley Hall, late of the priory of Christ Church, London, and which he had of the King’s gift (29 Aug. 1544). 10 Sept. 1545.
Whittlebury [N’hants.].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 78 John Portnale of Grafton, Richard Halle of Wyttylbury, William Halle of the same, and Richard, dean of Towcester, grant to John Colyer of Neuportpaynelle (Bucks.) and Juliana relict of William Maydeford of Wyttylbury, a meadow called Blodehangyrmede in W., all the lands which William Lynell of Maydeford holds from them at will, 16d. rent which they receive from Thomas Warde in Adstone, 4d. rent from John Farman in Adstone, 5/- rent from Geoffrey Hay in W., and 30d. rent from Simon Carter in W., and from [blank] Cony 2/- in Sylstone in W. for the life of Juliana. Witnesses: John Frayne, John Howman, Simon Carter, Robert Fyssher, John Sulbury. Given at W. 26 Oct. 1460.
Ardley [Oxon.].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 79 William fitz-Gerard grants to Godfrey de Belefosse for his homage and service two crofts in Ardlega called Wdecrofte. Rent: 12d., scutage 3d. Witnesses: Ralph Martel, William Martel, Simon fitz-Mercian, John fitz-Ralph, Richard fitz-Gilbert, William the clerk, Arnold de Wica, William Malore, Roger de Belefosse, Warin de Belefosse, Stephen de Belefosse. c. 1200. Endorsed to the effect that William Frost of Ardleye now (8 R. II.) holds the crofts.
Barton [Oxon.].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 80 Wimera, relict of Thomas Norton, quit-claims to John Spere and Alice his wife all his right in a messuage and a virgate of land with adjacent meadow, in Great Barton and Midelbarton. Given at Great Barton. 19 March 1402.
Bradwell [Oxon.].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 81 John Turgray of Anescote grants to John Gibbes of Westwelle a messuage with curtilage, croft, and ½ a virgate of arable land in Halewelle, in the parish of Bradewelle. Witnesses: Thomas Zorne, William Inge, Thomas Spicer, Henry Coteler, Reginald Cras, John Westone, William Eggard. Given at Haliwelle. 9 April 1409.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 82 Thomas Dye of Bureforde in Oxfordshire quit-claims to John Chapman of Alnescote (Oxon.) all his right in a messuage with curtilage, croft, and ½ a virgate of arable land in Halewelle in the parish of Bradewelle, which Thomas had of the gift of John Gybbes of Westwelle. Witnesses: William Cotillare of Bureford, John Punter’, John Moyser’, John Bounde, Thomas Chalkeleghe, William Turfray. Given at Bureford. 21 Dec. 1443.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 83 John Chepman de Alnescote (Oxfordshire) grants to John Hopere vicar of Buckelond, John Cockle of Cayndone (Wiltshire), and Thomas Smyth of Alnescote a messuage with curtilage, and croft, and ½ a virgate of arable land in Halewelle in the parish of Bradewelle (Oxon.), which he had of the gift of Thomas Dye of Bureford. Witnesses: William Cottelere of Bureforde, John Puntar’, John Mosyar’, John Boonde, Thomas Chalkeleghe, William Turfrar’. Given at Bureford. 21 Dec. 1443. Rounded oval seal, 1”, red wax. The Virgin (standing) and child, a figure kneeling in adoration.
Enstone [Oxon.].

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 84 Richard Ancelme, abbot &c. of Winchelcombe lease to Walter Walshe of Elmeley (Wyssetur) Esq., the parsonage of Enston with all lands &c. as Busby Marten Arden and William Rugely had it, for 70 years, after the term of Elinor Rugely who is now in possession. Rents: £18/13/4; £10, as is customary, to the vicar; 13/4, 2 quarters of wheat and 2 quarters of barley to the dean; 6/8 to the archdeacon of Oxford. Hospitality to the abbot for a day and night once a year. W. W. paid for this grant £30. 20 Aug. 1537. Endorsement that this lease was surrendered to Ch. Ch. 24 July 1605. Convent seal attached, with counter-seal of the abbot.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 84A Transcript of M. 84. Early 17 C.
MS. D. D. Ch. Ch. M. 85 Transcript of no. 290 in Eynsham Cartulary, vol. i. Endorsed: Mr. Palmer’s deed for common of pasture in S. Woods at Stoke. 37 Hen. III.

MS. D. D. Ch. Ch.
